meanings.definition: To assign tasks to be completed by an external party.
meanings.sent1: My boss often outtasks important projects to freelancers.
meanings.sent2: It is common for companies to outsource tasks to save time and money.
meanings.sent3: The busy bee outtasks gathering nectar to the younger bees.
meanings.sent4: In the game of chess, the queen outtasks the pawns in capturing opponents.
meanings.sent5: Outtasking responsibilities can help businesses focus on core activities.

meanings.definition: The act of delegating tasks to an outside source.
meanings.sent1: Outtasking can streamline workflow by utilizing external expertise.
meanings.sent2: The outtask of managing customer service was given to a specialized agency.
meanings.sent3: The outtask of watering the plants was assigned to the new gardener.
meanings.sent4: The outtask of organizing the event was successfully completed by the event planner.
meanings.sent5: Outtasks are essential for companies looking to expand their capabilities.
